Description: About half a South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim, mended from seven fragments; conical foot; interior: reserved line at top of lip, glazed black below; exterior: narrow black line at top of lip; lip and handle zone reserved with band between; glazed below; dilute bands on lip; handle glazed black save for interior: reserved underside with dipinto inscription.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies this sherd as coming from a Type 5C South Ionian cup with everted rim. These cups are both the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). 'A 1275' is written on a sticker glued to the exterior surface of the cup.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A1275)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (East Greek 211)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 49, no. 9, p. 94-6 NAU 38, pl. 9, no. a-c)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.094) (Phase 3)
